paper.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: material in the form of thin sheets that is used for writing on, wrapping things etc
paper.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I’ll get you a piece of paper so you can write the number down.
Do you have a pen and paper?
paper.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: You’ll read about it in tomorrow’s papers.
paper.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a set of printed questions used as an examination in a particular subject, and the answers people write
paper.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I have a stack of papers to mark.
The geography paper was really easy.
paper.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a piece of writing or a talk on a particular subject by someone who has made a study of it
paper.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Professor Usborne gave a paper on recent developments in his field.
paper.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a piece of writing that is done as part of a course at school or university
paper.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: a paper on the Civil War
paper.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a report prepared by a government or committee on a question they have been considering or a proposal for changes in the law
paper.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: We will publish a discussion paper on the future of the BBC.
a working paper (=a report that is not final) on funding the Health Service
the 1998 White Paper on political reform
paper.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: paper for covering and decorating the walls of a room
paper.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: stocks and shares  that can be bought and sold on a financial market
paper.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: soft thin paper used for cleaning yourself after you have used the toilet
paper.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: material in the form of thin sheets that is used for writing on, wrapping things etc
paper.translation[0].note_box[0].section: Each recipe was written down on a separate sheet of paper.
Can I have another piece of paper?
He scribbled Pamela’s address on a scrap of paper.
Chris took out a pad of paper and started writing.
Can you fetch me a piece of writing paper and a pen?
The package was wrapped in plain brown paper.
a note written on lined paper
He carefully removed the wrapping paper so it wouldn’t tear.
All the clothes were wrapped in tissue paper.
The envelopes are made from 100 percent recycled paper.
paper.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a newspaper
paper.translation[0].note_box[1].section: You could try putting an advert in the local paper.
The story had been in all the national papers.
Which of these daily papers do you usually read?
I only get a Sunday paper if I’ve got lots of spare time.
Ian usually buys an evening paper on his way home.
Don’t believe everything you read in the tabloid papers.
Tabloid newspapers are usually about half the size of a broadsheet paper.
Readers of quality papers, such as the Telegraph and the Guardian, are mainly employed in professional jobs.
paper.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The brochure is available in electronic and paper versions.
paper.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: existing only as an idea but not having any real value
paper.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: paper profits  (=a record of the value of something, that is not real until the thing is sold)
paper.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to decorate the walls of a room by covering them with special paper
paper.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: material in the form of thin sheets used for writing things on, wrapping things etc
paper.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: plants that make chemicals for the paper industry
paper.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: Many daily papers have a financial section.
The Hollywood Reporter is a trade paper (=one that reports on a particular industry) for the film industry.
paper.translation[3].definitions[2].defi: if you put ideas or information on paper, you write them down
paper.translation[3].definitions[2].exam: We need to get these ideas down on paper.
paper.translation[3].definitions[3].defi: if something seems to be true on paper, it seems to be true as an idea, but may not be true in a real situation
paper.translation[3].definitions[3].exam: It’s a nice idea on paper, but you’ll never get it to work.
paper.translation[3].definitions[4].defi: SECURITIES (=bonds etc) that can be traded on financial markets, rather than cash, and the CERTIFICATEs (=documents) relating to them
paper.translation[3].definitions[4].exam: Mitsubishi is to issue (=make available and sell) as much as 200 billion yen of paper.
There are times when people are doubtful of the viability of the financial paper they hold.
paper.translation[3].definitions[5].defi: documents used by a person or organization in their work
paper.translation[3].definitions[5].exam: The hotel filed papers (=officially sent them to the authorities) three weeks ago, seeking various building permits.
According tocourt papers, the judge’s decision was based on the bank’s failure to comply with banking laws.
paper.translation[3].definitions[6].defi: an official document you need in order to do something
paper.translation[3].definitions[6].exam: Once all the necessary papers have been signed, the house is yours.
